#50YardFantasyEntry I would LOVE to take my 15 y/o son, Cory Davis for his 16th Birthday.  Cory has been playing football since the age of 5.  He's played every position with quarterback being his favorite.  He's been to many mini Super Bowl's, playoffs, and championships throughout his years of play.  His last year of play was his Freshman year at Walnut Hills High School.  Cory has had many injuries during his football career, including a broken collar bone.  In spite of this injury, he continued to play through the pain in the championship game, as to not let his teammates down.  Cory has been a role positive role model and looked up to by many, including his 3 younger half brothers.  He has developed character along with team work from playing for all these years.  He's loved by many, and I would love to be able to treat my son, as he's Never been to an NFL game.  Thank You for the chance to win!

Both of my parent's died to cancer.......It is so great to see Leah and Devon, Lauren Hill and ALL the people that do what they do to help STOMP OUT cancer.......My heart goes out to any family that goes this....I understand all of the emotions that you go thru..........There WILL be a day when no family or child has to suffer this illness........God be with every single person that has to fight to stay alive due to this ugly disease..........My thoughts and prayers are with you all.

Devon Still is a wonderful man. I'm moved to tears by his reality and the way that he is helping the cancer community ... And way to go Cincinnati Bengals for standing behind him and helping him along the way. #whodey
Be blessed Leah, Devon, Fiancé  and family!

Devin still and his family my prayers are with you guys and the Bengals  showed class for allowing him to focus on his family first.This organization deserves the upmost respect.I love this story. God bless you guys.Cincinnati Bengals are the best employers
Congrats and well wishes for Leah and the rest of your family.
Way to go Cincinnati Bengals for supporting Devon to be a father and family man first before a football player!  A perfect "lead by example" that should be the model for situations like this.
Sending prayers to Devon & Leah.  You are both some kind of special!
Devon and Leah deserve the Arthur Asche award so much more then Bruce Jenner==What this family has gone thru shows true courage
Well done and the Bengals rock!

Devon is my favorite 
God bless him and his daughter.

One of the most touching, heartfelt speeches I've ever heard. I've always be a Bengals fan, but I'm now truly proud of my team. Devon Still is the kind of man I proud to cheer for, and the way the Bengals organization stood by him, was inspiring and wonderful. #LeahStrong. # Bengals Strong
God bless you and your family. I did not know your story until I saw you on the espy awards. I will be praying for Devon Still & Leah Still now and for her to kick cancers butt!
You are such an inspiration for all the kids that fight cancer. Thank you so much for allowing us to be involved in your fight. Go Leah-you rock
Get well soon sweetie. You can beat this.
❤️ they are so amazing! They are giving families so much hope and courage. So proud that he has donated so much time and money! Maybe the government should take a hint and donate more than 4%!!
She's a angel ! And you are amazing father . God has big plans for yall . Will keep yall in my prayers!
At least one person who got an espy actually deserved it.
Well done that man.
I'm so proud to be a Bengal fan! Thank you Cincinnati Bengal's organization for being top notch!
#LEAHSTRONG  <3
Kim Lovegrove Miller said it perfectly!!!!!
What a true gentleman and a great role model for all athletes
Should have received courage award too instead of fake Jenner
Proud to be a Bengal fan god bless you 2 #LEAHSTRONG
Bengals won a fan here! "When an employer sticks by their employee when they can do nothing for them" Very classy
Mr. Still, you are a great example of what a role model, father, and man should be. Thanks for speaking out on behalf of those affected by cancer and for representing Cincinnati so honorably.
The Bengals fans support you, Devon and Leah! Still Strong!!
So proud to be a Bengals fan this morning! How the Brown family treated Devon is how all employers should treat families going through this horrible disease.  #leahstrong
Who Dey!
What an excellent dad Devon is.  Way to step up Bengals!
Proud BENGALS fan. Stay strong Devon and Leah .
Very emotional. .great. speed. Cincinnati ...Bengals who Dey! #Leahstrong
Wonderful speech Devon!! Proud to be a Bengal fan. LeahStrong..
Bengals administration you have gained a fan in me for putting people first, and supporting Devon Still and his family. Helping #LeahStrong #BeatUpCancer
The best award speech ever!! May God continue to bless Leah and Devon!!!
Nicely done, Bengals...the Brown family, and Coach Lewis

What a joke. Bruce Jenner gets the Arthur Ashe award, but Devon Still talking about his daughter with cancer doesn't... I've lost all hope for America. Loved his speech! It brought me to tears. And I'm not even a Bengals fan. It's important to put sports aside when it comes to matters like this. We are all one team. Prayers up to Leah!
Yeah truth be told, the Bengals really did show loyalty. because to be completely honest, its not just that he wasn't available much. He actually isn't even very good. Most teams would have cut him.

And the Cincinnati Bengals --a team and a owner(s) and fans --that in my opinion are the positive representation as to what a true TEAM can do when they truly work as a TEAM. The entire NFL community should be kissing butts and rewarding the Cincinnati Bengals players,staff and owners for being a bright star of decency-with all the negativity that has been ignored ,pushed aside or discounted and heavily tarnished the nfl persona
A million whodey's for leah and god less devon still what a great father!!!

Best speech I've heard maybe EVER! God bless Devon & Leah!
Incredible heart felt acceptance speech.  Devon Still has and continues to be strong and gained a great deal of respect from many
An epic moment in sports history. Proud of our Bengals, Coach Lewis and continued prayers for #leahstrong

Michael Sedlock  No need to wait for Eifert to drop a pass while wide open, or fail to gain a 1st down on 3rd and 2, just refer back to the Baltimore game, he's already accomplished both.  Some Bengals fans are both hilarious and biased.  The suffer from ShipleyLeonard-likeitus.  Symptoms include an overwhelming desire to place a player on a undeserved pedestal based on making a couple plays.  Here's to hoping that Eifert turns into a top flight TE, but how bout letting him EARN the praise first.  This will be his first yr. being the no. 1 TE, let's hope he can do more than catch wide open passes.  He no longer has the shield of Gresham being the primary focus of the oppositions TE coverage.  This yr., let's see if he's Chase Coffman or can post close to 750 yds. and have 5-7 tds.  His days of free releases are over.  Let's see if he can block.   But don't be fooled, he's certainly no Gronk or Graham.  So before you  prematurely proclaim him a pro bowler or reserve his place in Canton, let's see what the kid has first; let him prove himself, first.

Our defensive line works because each player brings a different type of nasty. MJ will get 5-6 sacks and 22 knocked down passes because of his relentless style and long arms. Dunlap is big, fast and strong. He'll get around 14-16 sacks and about 3 forced fumbles. Atkins is pure strength and explosion. I say 14-16 sacks as well. Peko is your big quick wall that stops the run in its tracks. They all will pressure the QB and have depth that matches their identity. Throw them all together and that's why our line will be one of the best.
Mark Weisman FB #35

The key is Atkins. If he is fully healthy and can command double teams that makes it so much easier for everyone on the edge.

MJ has never been a great pass rusher. Good is top shelf for him. Dunlap is much better getting after the passer. As long as MJ can play the run well and be average rushing the passer he's an instant upgrade over Gilberry, who's abysmal as a run defender and should only be a situational rusher.

I've been one of Dalton's biggest supporters since they drafted him.  I gave him passes for being young, pointed out the statistical comparisions to Peyton Manning and other at the same points in their careers, and told the naysayers to shut up and give him a fair shot. But as far as I'm concerned, Dalton has no more excuses this year. The Bengals have a top 10 O-line in front of him, the best RB tandem in the NFL behind him, a stable of proven successful WRs, and now some added depth and talent at TE and also again at WR.  If he can't get a playoff win with this offense, he doesn't deserve to be a starting QB in the NFL and the Bengals should look elsewhere in the coming offseason for a signal caller.
